question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Be sure to provide executable code for demonstration whenever possible. Write a program that draws a heart.

checklist.title: Is the heart shape correctly implemented?
checklist.description: Verify if the code correctly generates a mathematically accurate heart shape. The heart should have a clear central V-point at the bottom, symmetrical lobes at the top, and smooth curves throughout. Deduct 5 points if the proportions are off, 7 points if the shape is distorted or asymmetrical. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the visualization method appropriate for the task?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the chosen visualization method (SVG, Canvas, CSS, ASCII art, etc.) is suitable and efficient for drawing a heart. Check if the code leverages the chosen technology's strengths. Score 10 points for optimal technology choice with proper implementation, 5 points if the technology is appropriate but implementation is suboptimal, 0 points if an inappropriate method is chosen.

checklist.title: Does the code provide customization options?
checklist.description: Check if the code allows for customization of the heart's properties such as size, color, rotation, border style, or fill pattern. Award 3 points for each independently adjustable property (size, color, position, animation, fill pattern), up to a maximum of 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the heart rendering responsive and adaptable?
checklist.description: Assess whether the heart scales appropriately across different screen sizes and resolutions. The heart should maintain its proportions and quality regardless of the viewing device. Deduct 5 points if the heart distorts on resizing, 3 points if it doesn't adapt to the container size. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as invalid inputs, browser compatibility issues, rendering errors, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Pulsating animation 2. Particle effects 3. Interactive elements that respond to user input). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple drawing methods coexisting) 2. Function modules unrelated to heart drawing (e.g., unnecessary UI controls) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive animations that slow down rendering). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating drawing logic/view/interaction layers), reusability, and code organization. Deduct 5 points if global namespace pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the code lacks comments or documentation. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the heart design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color choice for the heart and background 2) Proper spacing and positioning within the viewport 3) Clean rendering with smooth edges (no jagged lines or pixelation). Deduct 3 points for poor color contrast, 5 points for pixelated or rough edges, and 5 points for poor positioning or framing. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether any dynamic effects (if implemented) conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Animation timing feels natural (not too fast or slow) 2) Transition effects are smooth without stuttering 3) Interactive elements respond immediately to user input. Deduct 5 points for jerky animations, 3 points for delayed responses to user interaction, and 5 points for animations that feel unnatural or distracting. The full score is 10 points.
